subject: Inspection of failed Structures such as Bridges; Overpasses; Underpasses etc. during Construction or O&M Period by the Bridge Experts
text: HRdy 75 rTHRif giferas<ot (Tsq5 WRdav &r RTTFf 4AR4, 4RG TRaFR) National Highways Authority of India Harta T (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) 0il-5 Q 6, 7az7-10, ERaFT, 7f fcrft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 3MV /Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Miscellaneous/ 2024 Policy Circular No.18.97/2024 dated 19th September , 2024 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. DESIGN-23/7/2024-Design Division (Comp. No. 260658)} Sub: Inspection of failed Structures such as Bridges, Overpasses, Underpasses etc. during Construction or OGM Period by the Bridge Experts- reg: Vide Policy Guidelines No. 18.51 dated 28.08.2020 on Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) in case of failure of Structural Components on National Highways, it has been decided that a Committee of 3 Experts chosen from the empanelled list in the field of Structures (Bridges  _ Flyovers = ROBs/ RUBs, etc:) will be deputed by Technical Division with the approval of Member concerned to visit the Site within 24 Hours of incident in order to carry out Technical Analysis to find the reasons of failure and submit their Preliminary Report within 3 days and Final Report in 7 days to Member concerned: 2 The list of empanelled Bridge Experts for inspecting and analyzing the reasons for failure of Structures was notified vide NHAI Policy Guideline No. 18.53 dated 29.09.2020 (amended as Policy Guideline No. 18.54) and further updated vide NHAI's Policy Guideline No. 18.87 dated 25.05.2023 & NHAI's Policy Guideline No. 18.93 dated 28.11.2023. 3 In continuation to above, it is decided that occurrence of any such incident shall also be intimated to the Member In-charge (Design Division) , besides the concerned Member of Technical Division, who may then nominate one Officer from Design Division to visit the site with the Committee of 3 Experts. 4 All other Terms and Conditions of Policy Guidelines No. 18.51, 18.53 (amended as Policy Guideline No_ 18.54) , 18.87 & 18.93 will remain unchanged. 5_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
